abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Health Systems Development
            Project aims to assist the Nigerian authorities in
            redressing the deteriorated delivery of basic health care
            services, and, to build institutional capacities that would
            pave the way for a sustained development of the
            country's health care system. Through its components,
            the project will: 1) support all states in strengthening the
            capacity of the State Ministry of Health in the areas of
            planning, financial management, and monitoring and
            evaluation, while a limited support will be provided to
            improve the technical skills of trainers, and key health
            providers. Support activities will cover managerial
            processes and skills; technical skill development; improved
            health management information systems, and, access to
            information and communication technology, in addition to
            research and studies; 2) finance, and support activities
            that improve the delivery of primary health care services,
            emphasizing on strengthening immunization services, safe
            motherhood interventions, and communicable disease control
            (both endemic and epidemic diseases). Access to health care
            will be improved, as will the availability of essential, and
            generic drugs in health facilities, in addition to quality
            of training in nursing, mid-wife services, and health
            technology schools; and, 3) support capacity building, and
            strengthening of public health functions, and processes at
            the Federal Ministry of Health, and, coordinate, monitor and
            evaluate the implementation of the project. Support for the
            formulation of health policy, and strategies, the health
            reform process, and for strengthened management information
            systems will be financed.
